subject: Climate & Environment
title: Why Renewables Need Storage
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Renewables Need Storage.

hook.text: The sun doesn't always shine. The wind doesn't always blow. That's the intermittency problem.

buildup.text: On a cloudy, calm day, solar and wind output can drop to near zero simultaneously.

discovery.text: Storage bridges the gap â€” saving excess energy from sunny and windy hours for later.

twist.text: Without storage, grids must keep fossil fuel plants on standby, undermining clean gains.

climax.text: Four hours of storage paired with solar can replace most natural gas peaker plants.

punchline.text: Renewables generate the power. Storage delivers it on time.

quiz.question: What is the 'intermittency problem' in renewable energy?
options: Solar and wind output varies with weather
